Learn more about Ending the HIV Epidemic: A Plan for America. #WorldAIDSDay https://t.co/9QbYhOp09Y
By engaging closely with communities most affected by HIV, we can bring this terrible epidemic to an end in America within the decade and continue helping more countries around the world bring their epidemics under control.
In 2020, we awarded the first funds to start the implementation of our #EndHIVEpidemic initiative in the 57 jurisdictions that account for more than half of new HIV infections in the U.S. each year.
COVID-19 has been a challenge for many living with or at risk for HIV, but the groundbreaking public health work led by the HIV community over the past three decades has helped us fight back against this new threat.
This year, the HIV community has come together in remarkable and courageous ways to ensure that treatment and prevention services continue to reach those who need them most.
Even as COVID-19 has exacerbated so many health challenges, the Trump Administration remains deeply committed to the global fight against HIV/AIDS and our goal of ending the HIV epidemic in America by 2030. #WorldAIDSDay

Read more‚¨áÔ∏è  https://t.co/0sQXRrDXJG
Specifically, after inspecting the supplies, HHS arranged for the delivery of the PPE to the New Jersey Department of Health, the New York State Department of Health and the New York City Department of Health and Mental Hygiene.
HHS will pay the owner of the hoarded equipment pre-COVID-19 fair market value for the supplies and has begun distributing to meet the critical need for the supplies among healthcare workers in New York and New Jersey.
In addition to the N95 respirator masks, the supplies found included 598,000 medical grade gloves and 130,000 surgical masks, procedure masks, N100 masks, surgical gowns, disinfectant towels, particulate filters, bottles of hand sanitizer, and bottles of spray disinfectant.
The @FBI discovered the supplies during an enforcement operation by DOJ's COVID-19 Hoarding and Price Gouging Task Force on March 30 and alerted HHS. We used our authority under Defense Production Act to order that the supplies be immediately furnished to the US.
Today we announced that @TheJusticeDept and @HHSGov partnered to distribute more than half a million medical supplies confiscated from price gougers to those on the frontline of the #COVID10 response in New York and New Jersey‚Äîincluding approximately 192,000 N95 respirator masks.

RT @DrNancyM_CDC: The #2019nCoV diagnostic test kits will ship upon request to laboratories designed as qualified by CDC, including US stat‚Ä¶
While we will likely see more cases in the U.S., at this time, the risk to the American public is low ‚Äì and we are working around the clock to keep it that way.
We‚Äôve taken appropriate, temporary steps to restrict some travel coming from China to focus screening and detection efforts, while offering the help of our experts to learn more about the virus.
We‚Äôve been actively working on developing diagnostics, therapies, and vaccines, and rapidly developed and made available a diagnostic test for this new virus.
We‚Äôve been transparent with the American public: @CDCgov has held multiple press briefings each week to keep the public informed about our actions and what we know. We've declared a public health emergency.
Through the @CDCgov, we‚Äôve held multiple calls each week with state and local health officials, Clinician Outreach and Communication Activity (COCA) calls for clinicians and other health care providers, and have joined outreach calls with ASTHO, NACCHO, and similar organizations.

RT @SeemaCMS: "Today‚Äôs final rule drastically improves our ability to pay it right‚Äîto make the right payment to the right plan for the righ‚Ä¶
The separate billing requirement fulfills Congress‚Äô intent and reflects @POTUS‚Äôs strong commitment to preventing taxpayer funding of abortion coverage.
Providing these separate bills is an essential step in implementing the Affordable Care Act‚Äôs bar on tax credits going toward coverage of abortions for which public funding is prohibited.
In addition, when an exchange plan covers abortions for which public funding is prohibited by federal law, this rule requires that customers receive separate bills for that abortion coverage and for the rest of their insurance.
Being good stewards of taxpayer dollars and faithfully implementing the law are among the most important duties HHS has, and that‚Äôs what we‚Äôre doing with this rule. It‚Äôs part of much broader efforts at CMS, under @SeemaCMS, to improve program integrity &amp; reduce improper payments.
Today, @CMSGov issued the Exchange Program Integrity Final Rule, which implements policies aimed at protecting taxpayer dollars by ensuring that Exchange enrollees are accurately determined eligible for premium subsidies. https://t.co/GueCCc7O8r

.@POTUS has promised Americans a healthcare system with affordable, personalized care, a system that puts you in control, provides peace of mind &amp; treats you like a human being, not a number. Too often, government regulations have stood in the way of delivering that kind of care.
Today @HHSGov proposed historic reforms to the Anti-Kickback Statute &amp; the Physician Self-Referral Law to create new opportunities for coordinated, value-based care, while maintaining strong safeguards to protect patients and programs from fraud and abuse. https://t.co/Q2nq7e1PPF

@POTUS To close: Putting all Americans into one government-run healthcare system will not deliver a patient-centered system. @POTUS is determined to protect what‚Äôs working and fix what‚Äôs broken‚Äîleaving a legacy of better healthcare and better health for all 330 million Americans. https://t.co/lb9CsL5yE3
@POTUS Examples include the #EndHIVEpidemic initiative, maternal mortality and morbidity, rural healthcare, combating the #opioid crisis, the Advancing American Kidney Health initiative, and addressing non-health risk factors often called social determinants of health.
@POTUS Third: these transformations to financing and delivery of care are focused on one goal: better health. That‚Äôs why, as part of our healthcare vision, @POTUS has also identified a number of actionable, impactable public health challenges we face.
@POTUS Five ways we‚Äôre working to deliver better value: transparency around price and quality; advancing patient-centered health IT; reforming regulations; moving from paying for procedures to paying for outcomes; and lowering prescription drug costs.
@POTUS Second: Delivering financial protection in a fiscally sustainable way gets a lot easier if we look not just at insurance, as the Obamacare debate has often myopically focused, but also value in care delivery.
@POTUS .@POTUS has been very clear: We will always protect Americans with preexisting conditions‚Äîa guarantee we will maintain at the federal level. https://t.co/7h30AAHz1r
@POTUS First: When it comes to financing, protecting what works and fixing what‚Äôs broken means protecting Medicare and private insurance, improving those programs, and fixing the failures of the Affordable Care Act.
@POTUS There are three cross-cutting platforms where this administration is working to deliver on this, regardless of how their healthcare is financed: reforming the financing of care, deriving better value from that care, and improving health in specific, impactable areas.
@POTUS The key to building a better system at all levels, then, and the promise of @POTUS, is to protect what works in our system and fix what‚Äôs broken. For all 330 million Americans: We will protect what works and fix what‚Äôs broken. https://t.co/kHl5QkAl6b
@POTUS Many Americans are happy with what they have ‚Äì satisfaction ratings for #Medicare, MA, and employer-sponsored insurance are quite high. But Americans see flaws in our system and worry about what would happen if they became uninsured or need the individual insurance market.
@POTUS Americans covered by the ACA exchanges represent about 3 percent of our system. Many of them have suffered greatly, and we need to improve their experience‚Äîbut healthcare is much more than just Obamacare. The world is bigger than the debate over the Affordable Care Act. https://t.co/neDIpImJlu
@POTUS Delivering these results requires taking account of our system: We have ~60 million Americans in Medicare/Medicare Advantage; ~180 million in employer-sponsored market; ~70 million covered by Medicaid; ~10 million on the ACA exchanges; and ~29 million remain uninsured.
@POTUS Such a system will provide you with the affordability you need, the options and control you want, and the quality you deserve. I laid out this vision in a speech this morning at the Better Medicare Alliance #MASummit: https://t.co/k5vVS7x0sC https://t.co/b5h7O3KFbu

.@POTUS has delivered real, historic results to put American patients first, and under his leadership, drug prices will keep coming down.
And @CMSgov has proposed requiring real-time pharmacy benefit tools so that doctors can help patients know, right in the doctor‚Äôs office, what the cost of a drug will be for any patient‚Äôs insurance. No patient should have sticker shock at the pharmacy counter.
Just this week, @POTUS told drug companies they have to level with the American people about the cost of their drugs in their TV ads. If they‚Äôre ashamed of their prices, lower the price. It‚Äôs that simple. https://t.co/KJ25aSwcmX
And we have proposed a plan to replace a system of backdoor kickbacks with discounts for patients when they walk into the pharmacy and change the incentives that have driven drug prices up.
We‚Äôve put forward a plan to make sure Americans share in the discounts drug companies give to other countries on expensive drugs in Part B and to end foreign freeriding. #AmericanPatientsFirst https://t.co/WW7WSpAwuV
Seniors on Medicare Advantage are already benefiting from new negotiation tools that in the private market deliver 15-20% savings on drugs. And in 2018, they saved an estimated $320 million in out-of-pocket costs thanks to a change in how Medicare pays for drugs.
In October, @POTUS signed two pieces of legislation that banned pharmacy gag clauses, ensuring that now any time you ask your pharmacist if you‚Äôre getting the best deal, they can always help you find the lowest cost option for your medication.
For the first time in 46 years, the official government measure of inflation in drug prices actually dropped for all of 2018. And last year, more than a dozen companies cut their prices, froze prices, or rolled back price increases.
Throughout the first two years of the Trump Administration, @US_FDA has been approving high-quality, safe, and effective generics at historic rates. These generic approvals have generated an estimated saving of $26 billion for American patients.
Since then, @POTUS has been producing historic changes to drug pricing, delivering tougher negotiation, more competition, lower list prices, and lower out-of-pocket costs.
.@POTUS has done more than any President to address the high cost of prescription drugs for Americans. One year ago today, we stood in the Rose Garden at the @WhiteHouse and laid out the most ambitious plan to bring down drug prices any administration had put forward. https://t.co/Vcn3T1ueo8

RT @SeemaCMS: Today‚Äôs proposal from @HHSgov to reform the broken drug pricing system and incentivize upfront drug discounts is a huge step‚Ä¶
RT @newtgingrich: An important reform from @secazar and @realdonaldtrump. Not only will it save patients money on their prescriptions, it b‚Ä¶
Thanks to @POTUS, the era of backdoor deals in the drug industry is coming to an end, ushering in a new era where drug prices come down, discounts are delivered to your pocketbook, and every interest in our system finally has to put the American patient first.
Congress has an opportunity to follow through on their calls for transparency, too, by passing our proposal into law immediately and extending it into the commercial drug market.
Building a new system that really works will require cooperation‚Äîfrom drug companies that want to compete for patients, from pharmacy benefit managers who want to negotiate for patients, to physicians, pharmacists, researchers, and patient advocates.
Each year, more than $150 billion in rebates are passed around the drug industry, with patients left totally in the dark.  Under our proposal, the rebates moving around Part D, which total more than $29 billion, will be passed directly to patients, right at the pharmacy counter.
Today‚Äôs rebate system is set up in the shadows, to serve entrenched interests: drug companies who set these prices so high, and the pharmacy benefit managers who receive billions of dollars in rebates without patients ever knowing where the money goes.
How can anyone defend today‚Äôs catastrophically broken status quo that rewards higher prices, conceals kickbacks to middlemen, and denies seniors tens of billions of dollars of savings at the pharmacy counter?

This proposal has the potential to usher in the most significant change in how Americans‚Äô drugs are priced at the pharmacy counter, ever, and ease the burden of the sticker shock that millions of Americans experience every month for the drugs they need. https://t.co/gOlQVWsGpt
We will continue taking action until we have a truly competitive market for prescription drugs ‚Äî one in which prices will finally go down, not up. https://t.co/TdhurFShPh

And for those who continue to repeat that list prices don‚Äôt matter, let‚Äôs remember: Anyone who hasn‚Äôt spent through their deductible or has coinsurance is paying all or a percentage of the list price of the drugs they need. List prices matter.
For those listening in the pharmaceutical industry: The list price increases must stop. Prices must start coming down.
Maintaining the status quo, where higher priced drugs are more competitive and patients pay more, is unacceptable. Companies that announced price increases in January admitted they were doing so to funnel payments back to PBMs in order to keep the preferred status of their drugs.

We must also continue our work to remove the stigma that surrounds HIV so that no one is afraid to learn their HIV status, and receive treatment or take steps to prevent infection.

#Unite2FightCorona  Ten States/UTs account for 81.12% of the 482 case fatalities reported in the past 24 hours.  22.4% of new fatalities reported are from Delhi which reported 108 deaths. Maharashtra and West Bengal follow with 80 and 48 new deaths, respectively. https://t.co/W4WC7vq51u
#Unite2FightCorona  77.79% of the new cases are concentrated in 10 States and UTs.  Maharashtra reported the maximum daily new cases numbering 3,837 in the last 24 hours. Delhi recorded 3,726 new cases while Kerala reported 3,382 new cases yesterday. https://t.co/99gV6IHKGd
#Unite2FightCorona  The total recovered cases stand at 88,89,585 which translates to a Recovery Rate of 93.94%.   41,985 cases have recovered in the last 24 hours.  76.82% of the new recovered cases are observed to be concentrated in 10 States/UTs. https://t.co/Hk3TBd6KOC
#Unite2FightCorona  While some States (Kerala, Delhi, Karnataka, Chhattisgarh, etc) have witnessed a decline in the active caseload in the past 24 hours, others such as Uttarakhand, Gujarat, Assam, and Goa have reported addition to their caseload. https://t.co/nN3DODoHjJ
#Unite2FightCorona  Daily New Recoveries outnumber Daily New Cases.  31,118 new cases were added to the national tally in the last 24 hours. https://t.co/Shi5XF05Mv

The tests per million (TPM) has also increased to 96,871 tests. https://t.co/JxQsEJalVX
The daily positivity rate has dropped below 4%- is just 3.45% today.   Higher volumes of testing eventually lead to low Positivity Rate. https://t.co/R8oyhd4pw6

Maintaining the spree of registering more recoveries than the new confirmed cases, 83,011 single day recoveries were registered in last 24 hours as against 78,524 new confirmed cases.  75% of the new recovered cases are observed to be concentrated in 10 States/UTs. https://t.co/621qKGaAAp

#IndiaFightsCorona  The last 3 weeks' trend shows a steep decline in the national cumulative Positivity Rate.   Higher levels of testing on a sustained basis have aided in bringing down the positivity rate and containing the rate of infection spread. https://t.co/dQOKGiJ6bL
India has performed remarkably on fulfilling @WHO advice of 140 tests/day/ million population.  The national average of tests per day per million population stands at 865.  35 States/UTs performing more than 140 Tests/day/million population.  https://t.co/TesFoFCVeL https://t.co/4uc6pKwIIf

High levels of widespread TESTING lead to early identification, prompt isolation &amp; effective treatment of #COVID19 cases, and eventual low Fatality Rate.   The Positivity Rate also declines with high number of  tests thereby limiting spread of the infection.

India has amongst the lowest global fatality rates. While the global CFR stands at 2.97%, the comparative figure for India is 1.56%.  The global average is 130 deaths /million population. India is reporting 73 deaths /million population, one of the lowest in the world. https://t.co/HERew446kv

NMC to focus on quality of medical education &amp; standards.  It will continue &amp; accelerate reforms in medical education initiated over last 6 years (2014-2020).  Already, number of MBBS seats increased approx. by 48% from 54000 to 80,000; and PG seats by 79% from 24000 to 54000.
NMC will be a Regulatory body with Chairperson and Members 'selected on merit', as opposed to the MCI wherein they were 'elected'.
NMC will carry forward the reforms initiated by the Board of Governors under Dr V K Paul, Secretary General of Board of Governors.  Dr R K Vats will continue to work as Secretary of the NMC. https://t.co/5CK30HYoJB
Historic reform in MEDICAL EDUCATION: National Medical Commission (NMC) chaired by Dr S C Sharma (retd. Prof, ENT, AIIMS, Delhi) constituted today, along with 4 Autonomous Boards.   With this, the Medical Council of India (MCI) stands abolished.  https://t.co/RPNwWpm1LM https://t.co/PAV6wCRSU2
